meanings.def: not as great in size, amount or importance as something/somebody else
examples: They were all involved to a greater or lesser degree (= some were more involved than others).
The law was designed to protect wives, and, to a lesser extent, children.
He was encouraged to plead guilty to the lesser offence.
(humorous) He doesn’t even acknowledge us lesser mortals (= people who are not as important or powerful).
A lesser woman would have given up.

meanings.def: used in the names of some types of animals, birds and plants that are smaller than similar kinds
the less unpleasant of two unpleasant choices

idioms.idiom: the lesser of two evils | the lesser evil
idioms.def: the less unpleasant of two unpleasant choices

meanings.def: to a smaller degree than other people or things of the same kind
examples: one of the lesser-known Caribbean islands
